roles.name: Individual
roles.description: People who wants to explore the world of building things can choose this account type

roles.name: Entrepreneur
roles.description: Startups, teams, groups, organisation which are building a product, service or business can choose this account type

roles.name: Investor

roles.name: Mentor
roles.description: People who are subject matter experts, consultants, advisors, teachers can choose this account type

roles.name: Influencer
roles.description: Influencers, creators who creates content to help people to be successful can choose this account type

industries.name: Agriculture
industries.description: The cultivation and production of crops and livestock for food, fuel, and other products.

industries.name: Automotive
industries.description: The design, development, manufacturing, and marketing of motor vehicles and their components.

industries.name: Banking
industries.description: The business of accepting deposits, making loans, and providing financial services to individuals and businesses.

industries.name: Construction
industries.description: The planning, design, and construction of buildings, infrastructure, and other physical structures.

industries.name: D2C
industries.description: People who are building a company, product, business can choose this account

industries.name: Education
industries.description: The provision of instruction and learning opportunities, typically in formal settings such as schools and universities.

industries.name: Energy
industries.description: The production, distribution, and consumption of various forms of energy, including fossil fuels, renewable energy sources, and electricity.

industries.name: Finance
industries.description: Businesses involved in the provision and coordination of medical and related goods and services

industries.name: Healthcare
industries.description: The provision of medical services, including diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of illness and disease.

industries.name: Hospitality
industries.description: The business of providing services and accommodations to travelers and tourists, including lodging, food and beverage, and other amenities.

industries.name: Information Technology
industries.description: The use of computers, software, and telecommunications to process, store, and transmit information.

industries.name: Marketplace
industries.description: People who wants to explore the world of building things can choose this account type

industries.name: Manufacturing
industries.description: The production of goods through the use of machinery, tools, and labor, often in large-scale factories or other facilities.

industries.name: Retail
industries.description: The sale of goods and services directly to consumers through physical stores or online channels.

industries.name: SAAS
industries.description: People who wants to explore the world of building things can choose this account type

industries.name: Transportation
industries.description: The movement of people, goods, and materials from one location to another, including by land, air, and sea.

payments.name: Credit Card
payments.description: A payment method that allows the buyer to pay for goods or services using a credit card.

payments.name: Debit Card
payments.description: A payment method that allows the buyer to pay for goods or services using funds from their checking account.

payments.name: Bank Transfer
payments.description: A payment method that allows the buyer to transfer funds directly from their bank account to the seller's bank account.

engineering.name: Software Engineer
engineering.description: A software engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications. They typically have experience with one or more programming languages and are comfortable working in a team environment.

engineering.name: Data Scientist
engineering.description: A data scientist is responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights. They typically have a strong background in mathematics, statistics, and computer science.

engineering.name: UI/UX Designer
engineering.description: A UI/UX designer is responsible for designing the user interface and user experience for software applications. They typically have experience with design tools such as Sketch or Adobe XD and are comfortable working in a team environment.

engineering.name: Project Manager
engineering.description: A project manager is responsible for leading a team to complete a project within the specified timeline and budget. They typically have experience in project management methodologies such as Agile or Waterfall and are comfortable communicating with stakeholders.

engineering.name: Business Analyst
engineering.description: A business analyst is responsible for identifying opportunities for improving business operations and processes. They typically have experience in data analysis and are comfortable working with stakeholders to gather requirements.

engineering.name: Quality Assurance Engineer
engineering.description: A quality assurance engineer is responsible for testing software applications to ensure they meet the specified requirements and quality standards. They typically have experience with testing methodologies and tools and are comfortable working in a team environment.

engineering.name: DevOps Engineer
engineering.description: A DevOps engineer is responsible for managing the infrastructure and deployment pipelines for software applications. They typically have experience in software development and operations and are comfortable working with tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.

engineering.name: Technical Writer
engineering.description: A technical writer is responsible for creating documentation for software applications and other technical products. They typically have experience in writing technical documentation and are comfortable working in a team environment.

database.name: MySQL
database.description: An open-source relational database management system that is widely used for web applications.

database.name: PostgreSQL
database.description: A powerful open-source object-relational database system that is highly scalable and has strong data integrity features.

database.name: MongoDB
database.description: A popular open-source NoSQL document-oriented database that is highly scalable and flexible.

database.name: Oracle
database.description: A powerful and widely used relational database management system that offers a broad range of functionality.

database.name: SQLite
database.description: A lightweight, file-based relational database management system that is often used for mobile applications.

database.name: Microsoft SQL Server
database.description: A popular relational database management system that is widely used in enterprise applications.

languages.name: Python
languages.description: A high-level, interpreted programming language that is easy to learn and widely used for scripting, web development, data analysis, and more.

languages.name: Java
languages.description: A general-purpose, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to be portable and highly maintainable.

languages.name: JavaScript
languages.description: A high-level, dynamic, interpreted programming language that is widely used for web development and client-side scripting.

languages.name: C++
languages.description: A powerful, high-performance programming language that is widely used for developing operating systems, game engines, and other performance-critical applications.

languages.name: PHP
languages.description: A popular server-side scripting language that is widely used for web development and can be embedded into HTML.

languages.name: Ruby
languages.description: A dynamic, open-source programming language that is designed for simplicity and productivity.

languages.name: C#
languages.description: A modern, object-oriented programming language that is designed for building Windows desktop applications, games, and web services.

languages.name: Go
languages.description: An open-source programming language that is designed for building highly concurrent and scalable systems.

languages.name: Swift
languages.description: A powerful, open-source programming language that is designed for building apps for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS.

languages.name: Kotlin
languages.description: A modern, statically typed programming language that is designed to interoperate with Java and is widely used for building Android apps.

languages.name: Rust
languages.description: An open-source programming language that is designed for building safe and efficient systems, particularly for low-level systems programming.

languages.name: TypeScript
languages.description: A superset of JavaScript that adds optional static typing and other features that make it easier to build large-scale applications.

frameworks.name: React
frameworks.description: A declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

frameworks.name: Angular
frameworks.description: A comprehensive JavaScript framework for building dynamic web applications.

frameworks.name: Vue.js
frameworks.description: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.

frameworks.name: Node.js
frameworks.description: An open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment for building server-side applications.

frameworks.name: Django
frameworks.description: A high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

frameworks.name: Ruby on Rails
frameworks.description: An open-source web framework that uses the Ruby programming language and follows the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architectural pattern.

frameworks.name: Spring
frameworks.description: A popular Java framework for building web and enterprise applications.

frameworks.name: Express.js
frameworks.description: A fast, minimalist web framework for Node.js that is widely used for building APIs and web applications.

frameworks.name: Laravel
frameworks.description: A free, open-source PHP web framework that is designed for building web applications with elegant syntax and expressive code.

frameworks.name: Flask
frameworks.description: A lightweight Python web framework that is easy to learn and use.
